content.description:
Short layback up and onto a ledge. Place a #2 and move slightly up. Place some thin gear (nuts, ball-nut) in a tiny roof crack above you to protect. Strenuous sloper moves up to a 0.5 cam in a horizontal. Continuous effort until a #1 placement in a flake on the right. Finish up the beautiful arete, with a horizontal 0.2 just before the top out.

Stick to the arete from start to finish for full value. Divert right and left slightly to reduce the difficulty a bit.

Tree belay, Scramble down the backside for descent. Watch out for all the ants up at the belay.



Obvious arete visible on the right just before scrambling up and over to the original Ramparts wall.


Single rack 0.2 - 2, small gear (nuts, ball-nuts) to protect crux. Tree Belay.

Start up blocky features same as "The Queen". Pull into the dihedral under the roof. Extend some gear then exit right onto the arete. Crux moves pulling the roof onto a sloping ledge. continue upwards to a tree belay.

Walk-off down a large chimney climbers front-left.



Look for the obvious triangular block feature which is the middle of both "Burrowing" and "The Queen", in the gully behind the main ramparts wall.

Single rack to 3". (Optional double 1, 2) Alpines to extend. Tree Belay.

Start up blocky section same as "Burrowing". Break right under the block into the perfect finger crack. Excellent gear up this crack as you work your way up through the crux to the horizontal. Continue right up through more blocks and some mantling to the top.

Walk off down a chimney scramble climbers front left.



Look for the obvious triangular block feature forming the middle of this route and "Burrowing", in the gully behind the main Ramparts wall.

Single rack 0.2 - 4". 3-4 Alpines. Tree Belay.
Enter a description of this area.
